CmdDelete Class Reference

Detailed Description

CmdDelete class is the delete command stored in the command stack.

CmdDelete represents a single node delete action on a scene. Deletes a node from the scene and all children.

See also:
CmdCopy, CmdCut, CmdPaste

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CmdDelete::CmdDelete ( const QModelIndex &  selectedIndex,
SceneModel &  model,
QUndoCommand *  parent = 0 
)

Creates a new delete command that represents the selectedIndex node in the model deletion.

If parent is not null, this command is appended to parent's child list and then owns this command.

CmdDelete::~CmdDelete (  )

Destroys the CmdDelete object.

Member Function Documentation

void CmdDelete::redo (  ) [virtual]

Applies a change to the scene. After redo() the scene will not contain the node located on the model as selectedIndex.

See also:
undo().
void CmdDelete::undo (  ) [virtual]

Reverts deletion. After undo() is called, the state of the model will be the same as before redo() was called.

See also:
redo().
